subsc: Central government administration,Sub-national government administration,Roads and highways,Ports, waterways and shipping,Micro- and SME finance

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Peru Second Rural Roads
            Project were as follows: outcomes were highly satisfactory,
            the risk to development outcome was moderate, the Bank
            performance was highly satisfactory, and the Borrower
            performance was highly satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: 1) improved transport conditions of rural roads
            can translate into better access to social services (health,
            education) and to income-generating opportunities; 2)
            participatory planning and inclusion can ensure better
            targeting of resources while better responding to community
            needs; 3) maintenance strategy for transport infrastructure
            can act as a catalyst for developing private sector and
            entrepreneurial attitudes; and 4) women's involvement
            in road project design and maintenance activities can result
            in social outcomes commonly ignored by traditional road upgrading.
